title: Beige velvet cheongsam with matching jacket
content:
accession_no_csv: 2016-00176

  Image: 

  object_work_type: folk costume jackets (garments)

  title_text: Beige velvet cheongsam with matching jacket

  preference: main

  title_language: 

  creation_date: 1960 - 1969

  creation_place_original_location: Singapore

  styles_periods_indexing_terms: Chinese (culture or style)

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: velvet (fabric weave)

  techniques_name: devoré machine sewing (technique)

  object_colour: beige (colour)

  physical_appearance: This is a beige cheongsam that is paired with a matching jacket
 also beige in colour. Floral patterns can be seen throughout the cheongsam and its jacket. A collar is present on the cheongsam as well. There are three pairs of buttons running vertically down the centre of the jacket. They are shaped like flowers. There are no visible tears on the cheongsam.

  subject_terms_1: dresses (garments) womenswear floral patterns allover patterns

  subject_terms_2: Qipao Ethnic costume Motifs Jackets Women\u0027s clothing

  subject_terms_3: Ethnic costume Chinese costume

  sgcool_label_text: The cheongsam and matching jacket has a burn-out floral pattern which is produced by using chemicals to dissolve parts of the velvet to create the pattern. The matching jacket has three intricately-designed flower buttons which match the floral motif of the fabric.

metadata.title_text: Beige velvet cheongsam with matching jacket
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a beige cheongsam that is paired with a matching jacket, also beige in colour. Floral patterns can be seen throughout the cheongsam and its jacket. A collar is present on the cheongsam as well. There are three pairs of buttons running vertically down the centre of the jacket. They are shaped like flowers. There are no visible tears on the cheongsam.
